name: detach
title: .detach()
desc: Remove the set of matched elements from the DOM.

argument.desc: A selector expression that filters the set of matched elements to be removed.
argument.name: selector

examples.desc: Detach all paragraphs from the DOM
examples.css: p { background:yellow; margin:6px 0; } p.off { background: black; }

entries.longdesc: The .detach() method is the same as .remove(), except that .detach() keeps all jQuery data associated with the removed elements. This method is useful when removed elements are to be reinserted into the DOM at a later time.
